data.title: Fix code folding keyboard mix up
data.body:
The current implementation for keyboard bindings to code folding works as advertised (in the default keyboard bindings file) for single fold/unfold, but foldAll/unfoldAll is flipped.
This pull request fixes that.

Note: it is possible that the keyboard bindings are back to front i.e open/close square bracket. I have not changed them and do not know which you intended to do what. Feedback in the comments on this would be appreciated.

data.title: Var and function keywords not colored in js
data.body:
I know you mentioned `function` not being colored, but I do not remember you saying that `var` is not coloured.

![screen shot 2016-02-18 at 09 45 52](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13137942/7351c318-d624-11e5-9242-f25ffeb8a571.png)

data.title: [alt + click]
data.body: [alt + click] for custom multiple cursors does not work on Linux.

data.title: Forward arguments in the shell script correctly: use "$@" instead of $*
data.body:
Also made a few other changes:
- added an `exec` to improve performance (which replaces the current process instead of spawning a subshell)
- changed the shebang to `#!/usr/bin/env`, as this is best practice.

data.title: Better detection of unused variables
Show StoppedEvent.text in the UI
Make relative cwd values relative to the workspace root

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Since the january release, when I open VS Code from the start menu and (last opened project opens) and hit Ctrl+Shift+B, I get

```
Failed to launch external program gulp .
spawn C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe ENOENT
```

I can of course asure you that C:\Windows\system32\cmd.exe does exist and gulp is installed globally and in PATH. I can restart Code as many times as I want, it only works when opening Code though right click on folder > open with Code.

data.title: Ctrl+F on selection does rarely use selection as search term
data.body: Since january update, when I select some text and hit Ctrl+F, only very rarely does this selection get used as the search term. Instead, most of the time, the old value is still there and the "replace" input gets focused.

data.title: Show corresponding commands when hovering over Git menu items
data.body:
The Git menu has a couple items that use terminology that doesn't originate from within Git. ("Sync", "Clean All", "Publish"?  What are these going to do?)  Even when they do, it's still not always clear what exactly will happen when you click them.  ("Pull" pulls from where?  Origin?  Using its branch of of the same name as the one that's checked out on your repo?)

Hovering over any of these items should show the commands that these items correspond with, so you know exactly what they're going to do.

data.title: Files renamed using VSCode Explorer panel are listed as deleted and recreated in git panel
data.body: VSCode is able to detect files renamed using `git mv` as distinct from simply showing the old filename as deleted and the new one as created. But if I rename a file using VSCode's Explorer pane while I have a git-enabled folder open, it looks like it doesn't use `git mv` (at least in OS X), because the git panel then shows the file as being deleted and recreated.  This occurs as of VSCode 0.10.8 in OS X.

data.title: A bug was introduced (latest update?)
data.body:
While editing Javascript file in OS X:

Select block of code w/comments (not sure having comments is required) hit TAB:
    Expected: increase indent.
    Result: text is messed-up thru the end of file. Undo does not recover text.

data.title: Support octicons in show*Message dialogs

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
What do you think about also supporting octicons in the label of the `show*Message` popup?

Maybe via an option to prevent other extension developers from suffering of parsing issues?

data.title: The Call Stack debug pane doesn't offer tooltips for long function names
data.body: When a function name is too long to show fully within the Call Stack debug pane, there is no tooltip shown when you hover over the function name.

data.title: Open folder not discoverable enough in no-workspace view
data.body: The Debug pane tells you to open a folder in order to debug, but there is no "Open Folder" button there like there is in the Explore pane. Perhaps we could have the same "Open Folder" button there - or at least give you a pointer as to how you can open a folder in VS Code.

data.title: Diff slider is out of sync

data.title: Multiple cursors binding
data.body:
On most Linux desktops `alt+click` will allow you drag a window by clicking anywhere over it. This conflicts with the multiple cursors binding.

It's still possible to obtain multiple cursors with commands like `insertCursorAbove` or `insertCursorAtEndOfEachLineSelected`, but this affects multiple people, and it's already covered in some [articles](https://2buntu.com/articles/1529/visual-studio-code-comes-to-linux/#multiple-cursors_3044) with a workaround (which I'm copying here for Gnome based systems: `gsettings set org.gnome.desktop.wm.preferences mouse-button-modifier "<Super>"` change `<Super>` with your preferred key )

It's also acknowledged [in VScode's documentation](https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/editor/editingevolved#_selection-multicursor) that this shortcut might conflict even on Windows or Macosx...

> Note: Your graphics card provider might overwrite these default shortcuts.

So, fixing this for Linux users might also be useful elsewhere. For comparison, the Atom editor uses `ctrl+click` instead of `alt+click` for this shortcut.

Rather than changing the default, making it customizable would already be a welcome improvement, but afaik unfortunately there's no way to change it. These are a couple of related default keybindings:

```
{ "key": "ctrl+shift+up",         "command": "editor.action.insertCursorAbove",
                                 "when": "editorTextFocus" },
{ "key": "shift+alt+up",          "command": "editor.action.insertCursorAbove",
                                 "when": "editorTextFocus" }
```

But since I cannot find any `editor.action.insertCursor` command, it seems that this option is lacking.

data.title: F3 does not loop with two matches on a single line
data.body:

```
import nls = require('vs/nls');
```

data.title: previewHtml() support to define the server root path
data.body:
1. Is scripting enabled?   (#2099 implies so, but I'm not seeing it)
2. Can the server root path be configured?  It looks like by default it's pointing somewhere in the vscode executable path, so references have to be absolute.

Breakpoint hover: use fixed-width font only when showing the breakpoint condition

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently the breakpoint hover always uses a fixed-width font which makes messages appear wider than necessary. I suggest to use a variable-pitch font by default and switch to the fixed-width font only when showing the expression of a conditional breakpoint.

data.title: Offer the user to configure a task when the 'preLaunchTask' isn't found
data.body:
When a launch config refers to a `preLaunchTask` that does not exist then we show this message:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13108138/9d90aed6-d571-11e5-83dc-f40bbcd6ecce.png)

We should handle this error situation more gracefully:
- inform the which preLaunchTask could not be found and that task.json should be configured
- offer the user to create a task.json by presenting the `configure task runner` command: 
  ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/172399/13108298/74210df6-d572-11e5-98d4-267ee25da8b1.png)
- the default generated task template should include a task.json for .net

data.title: JS - actively inform user that the JS support has changed and point to the change notes
Salsa: symbols not found (ES5)
data.body:
I have activated salsa and when activated, some symbols cannot be found anymore in ES5 files.

For example, if I have a a file with only:

```
function toto() {
}
```

Typing `@toto`will work and highlight the toto function.

But if I wrap the code into a closure, it doesn't work anymore:

![salsa](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/199648/13107988/b5b09720-d570-11e5-8e1a-9a00e8c5984b.jpg)

Without salsa, it works as expected, highlighting the toto function even if it is wrapped into a closure.

Code 0.10.8
Windows 10
